snippet: President Hassan Rouhani intends to deliver three speeches at the United Nations in New York this month, and the visit will afford him a chance to distinguish himself from Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
abstract: Iran's Pres Hassan Rouhani, cleric who was elected in June 2013 after promising to ease country’s economic isolation and tensions with West over its disputed nuclear program, intends to deliver three speeches at United Nations General Assembly in New York; visit will afford him a chance to distinguish himself from Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
lead_paragraph: President Hassan Rouhani intends to deliver three speeches at the United Nations in New York this month, and the visit will afford him a chance to distinguish himself from Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.

headline.main: Iran’s President to Speak at the U.N.
headline.print_headline: New Iranian President to Speak at the U.N.
